t: Job 37
At*p this also my heart trembleth, and is moved out of his place.
Hear*p attentively the noise of his voice, and the sound that goeth out of his mouth.
He*p directeth it under the whole heaven, and his lightning unto the ends of the earth.
After*p it a voice roareth: he thundereth with the voice of his excellency; and he will not stay them when his voice is heard.
God*p thundereth marvellously with his voice; great things doeth he, which we cannot comprehend.
For*p he saith to the snow, Be thou on the earth; likewise to the small rain, and to the great rain of his strength.
He*p sealeth up the hand of every man; that all men may know his work.
Then*p the beasts go into dens, and remain in their places.
Out*p of the south cometh the whirlwind: and cold out of the north.
By*p the breath of God frost is given: and the breadth of the waters is straitened.
Also*p by watering he wearieth the thick cloud: he scattereth his bright cloud:
And*p it is turned round about by his counsels: that they may do whatsoever he commandeth them upon the face of the world in the earth.
He*p causeth it to come, whether for correction, or for his land, or for mercy.
Hearken*p unto this, O Job: stand still, and consider the wondrous works of God.
Dost*p thou know when God disposed them, and caused the light of his cloud to shine?
Dost*p thou know the balancings of the clouds, the wondrous works of him which is perfect in knowledge?
How*p thy garments are warm, when he quieteth the earth by the south wind?
Hast*p thou with him spread out the sky, which is strong, and as a molten looking glass?
Teach*p us what we shall say unto him; for we cannot order our speech by reason of darkness.
Shall*p it be told him that I speak? if a man speak, surely he shall be swallowed up.
And*p now men see not the bright light which is in the clouds: but the wind passeth, and cleanseth them.
Fair*p weather cometh out of the north: with God is terrible majesty.
Touching*p the Almighty, we cannot find him out: he is excellent in power, and in judgment, and in plenty of justice: he will not afflict.
Men*p do therefore fear him: he respecteth not any that are wise of heart.
